title: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf | Global Leadership Foundation

quotes: President, Liberia 2006-2018
In 2011 she won the Nobel Peace Prize.
Ellen Johnson Sirleaf began her career in the Treasury Department in Liberia in 1965.
In 1979, she rose to the position of Minister of Finance and introduced measures to curb the mismanagement of government finances.

After the 1980 military coup d’état, she became president of the Liberian Bank for Development and Investment, but fled Liberia that same year, escaping an increasingly suppressive military government.
a post she resigned to contest the 1997 presidential elections.
Ellen Johnson Sirleaf was elected President of the Republic of Liberia in 2005, two years after the nation’s bloody civil war ended.
Her historic inauguration as Africa’s first democratically elected head of state took place on January 16, 2006.
She won re-election in November 2011.

organizations.name: United Nations Development Programme
quotes: Prior to her first campaign for the presidency, Johnson Sirleaf served as assistant administrator of the United Nations Development Programme and as director of its Regional Bureau of Africa, with the rank of assistant secretary-general of the United Nations, a post she resigned to contest the 1997 presidential elections.

organizations.name: Measuagoon
quotes: While in exile, she established a venture capital vehicle for African entrepreneurs and founded Measuagoon, a Liberian community development NGO.

organizations.name: Governance Reform Commission
quotes: Prior to the election, she had served in the transitional government, where she chaired the Governance Reform Commission and led the country’s anti-corruption reform.

President, Liberia 2006-2018
Ellen Johnson Sirleaf began her career in the Treasury Department in Liberia in 1965.

After the 1980 military coup d’état, she became president of the Liberian Bank for Development and Investment, but fled Liberia that same year, escaping an increasingly suppressive military government.
Ellen Johnson Sirleaf was elected President of the Republic of Liberia in 2005, two years after the nation’s bloody civil war ended.
While in exile, she established a venture capital vehicle for African entrepreneurs and founded Measuagoon, a Liberian community development NGO.
Johnson Sirleaf has also served as vice president of Citicorp’s Africa regional office in Nairobi, as senior loan officer at the World Bank, and as a vice president for Equator Bank.
After coming in second, she went into self-imposed exile in neighboring Cote d’Ivoire (Ivory Coast).
